duties_responsibilities.duty: Oversee field inspection activities and ensure work is done in accordance with applicable codes and standards.
Maintain relationships with field personnel and work with contractor inspectors, welders, fabricators, equipment coaters, etc.
Ensure inspection requirements are met for pressure vessels, piping, and tanks.
Coordinate, manage, and oversee contractors’ inspections to meet inspection requirements.
Liaise with Project QA/QC personnel to help with fabrication certification and certify fabrication shops and well locations.
Provide QA/QC for base capital projects and maintenance work.
Track recommendations and repairs to closure, participate in equipment Failure Mode Analysis, Events Root Cause Analysis, Incident Investigations, and HSE Audits.

Participate in the development and implementation of short-term inspection plans and travel approximately 25% of the time to aid in completion and documentation of Inspection, Testing, and Repair of equipment.
Write excavation and trenching permits or confined space entry permits for inspection activities.

education_certification.credential: Current/Valid driver's license, Certified Welding Inspector certification, 5+ years of equipment inspection experience related to pressure vessels, tanks, and piping.
